Welp, this comment section is cancer. Some can't tell fantasy from reality, some seem to be IRL pedos making pro-pedo arguments (legislating in comment sections), some are warning pedos not to do pedo stuff (good luck with that, btw). The little girl is a predator. She locks him in a room and demands he have sex with her, then toys with him when he finally gives in. All his rage is unleashed and he rapes her repeatedly, and then he can't control himself at work when the projected object of his resentment isn't close at hand. ALL of the stories, STORIES MIND YOU, end with the "little girl" giggling as she skips on to her next victim and the men facing consequences. Predators know those who are weak to them and they exploit those weaknesses. How this turned into "children need love too" argument, when this girl isn't looking for love but REVENGA, I have no clue, but I want no part of it.

About this true love crap, a children genuinely can't think for himself, and can't see nor call out your flaws for what they are. Now if love there is, what would it be but blind love? another ex: i'm all out for teach-student sex, but it's the same problem. We ask them "Are you sure about doing this?", "Is it really what you want?" In such a taboo relationship, most would hesitate, those who did not didn't bother to think about it. And if it's ok, then sure, get together after graduation and stuff. But allowing teach-student is opening a gateway to abuses and regrets.
I do think people feel more alone and broken nowadays, and I still hate myself sometimes. But instead of fantasising about pure love, can't you do something to feel better about yourself, and not relying on cecity to feel remotely liked by another? 
We see a broken man or woman, we feel sympathy, that's right, even compassion. But then we ask ourselves "Why won't you get your life together?"

"And what will it take?"
